Description: Mould-made pottery Frog-Type lamp with a large filling-hole area and a many-petalled rosette within two plain mouldings. The upper shoulder is decorated with a band of slanting grooves defined below by a single plain moulding terminating in an impressed circle on each side of the nozzle. The undefined base is decorated with deeply impressed marks including spirals, a crescent and stars. The surface is slightly damaged in places.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2141.ter)
